moves.1. e3: I decided to take hold of the centre
moves.1... e5 2. b3: fianchetto giving me a bigger bite
moves.5. Be2 Bb4+: Here i wanted to stir and see what he does, would he weeken his pawn structure?
moves.6. c3 Ba5: so he does which was a mistake
moves.7. b4 Bb6: just moving out of harms way
moves.8. b5 Na5: my pan here was a6, exchange and then knight tob7
moves.11. f3 Bd7: her i had lots of options bishop takes pawn exchange gives me a pawn up, knight to c4...
moves.15. Qc1 axb5: now the knight is helped by the rook
moves.17. Bb4 Qh4+: i had seen this earlier but did not want to play it to early - wins  a rook
moves.18. g3 Qe4: there is no way to defend this rook
moves.19. Qd2 Qxh1: i was waiting for queenf2 which would hold the position for white instead my oponent missed his chance
moves.20. e4 Qxg1+: i was thinking Ke2, take the rook........  then i saw the unplanned mate, i make a point of looking for mates as i believe greed makes a lot of players miss oppertunities like this
moves.21. Ke2 Bg4#: Mate.... not planned and nearly missed....
